author: @eldeber
title: El papa insta a "negociar" para poner fin a la guerra en Ucrania | El Deber
text: Mundo GUERRA EN UCRANIA El papa insta a "negociar" para poner fin a la guerra en Ucrania "La palabra negociar es una palabra valiente. Cuando ves que est√°s derrotado, que las cosas no van bien, necesitas tener el coraje de negociar", a√±adi√≥ el l√≠der de la Iglesia cat√≥lica El papa Francisco inst√≥ a las partes en conflicto en Ucrania a negociar "antes de que las cosas empeoren", en una entrevista difundida este s√°bado por la televisi√≥n suiza. "Creo que son m√°s fuertes quienes ven la situaci√≥n, quienes piensan en el pueblo, quienes tienen el coraje de izar la bandera blanca y negociar", declar√≥ el papa durante una entrevista de la radio televisi√≥n suiza RTS, realizada a inicios de febrero. "La palabra negociar es una palabra valiente. Cuando ves que est√°s derrotado, que las cosas no van bien, necesitas tener el coraje de negociar", a√±adi√≥. "Te da verg√ºenza, pero ¬øcon cu√°ntas muertes terminar√°?", continu√≥ el jesuita argentino, de 87 a√±os. "Hoy, por ejemplo, en la guerra de Ucrania, hay muchos que quieren actuar como mediadores. Turqu√≠a se ofreci√≥ a ello. Y otros. No tengan verg√ºenza de negociar antes de que las cosas empeoren", inst√≥. El presidente turco, Recep Tayyip Erdogan, afirm√≥ el viernes que su pa√≠s estaba dispuesto a acoger conversaciones de paz entre Kiev y Mosc√∫, tras una reuni√≥n con su par ucraniano, Volodimir Zelenski, en Estambul. En las primeras semanas de la guerra, que empez√≥ con la invasi√≥n rusa de Ucrania el 24 de febrero de 2022, Turqu√≠a hab√≠a acogido negociaciones de paz entre ambos pa√≠ses, aunque estas fracasaron. Los periodistas tambi√©n le preguntaron sobre la guerra entre Israel y el movimiento islamista Ham√°s en la Franja de Gaza. "La guerra la hacen dos, no uno. Los irresponsables son estos dos que hacen la guerra", contest√≥.

author: Business Standard
title: IMD issues red alert for Maharashtra, MP; orange alert for Kerala, Himachal | India News - Business Standard
text:
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a "red" alert for extremely heavy rainfall in Madhya Maharashtra and East Madhya Pradesh for Friday.
Additionally, the IMD has warned of very heavy rains in various regions across the country, including Himachal Pradesh, Kerala, Uttarakhand, Konkan, Goa, Gujarat, Rajasthan, Karnataka, Assam, and Meghalaya. Click here to connect with us on WhatsApp
The Met department on Friday issued a "yellow" alert for Mumbai, Palghar, and Thane. Districts such as Raigad, Ratnagiri, and Sindhudurg are under an "orange" alert due to forecasts of very heavy rainfall. Furthermore, a "red" alert has been issued for extremely heavy rainfall in the ghat regions of Pune, Kolhapur, and Satara.
Himachal Pradesh cloudbursts: 5 dead, over 50 missing; rescue ops on
In Himachal Pradesh, the districts of Mandi, Shimla, and Kullu have been struck by cloudbursts, resulting in over 50 missing persons and the recovery of five bodies.
ALSO READ: Himachal cloudbursts: 5 dead, over 50 missing; IMD issues flash flood alert
Additional Chief Secretary Onkar Chand Sharma stated that a heavy rain alert has been issued until August 2. An "orange" alert has been declared in Kanga district on Friday, with heavy rain also forecasted for Sirmaur, Solan, Mandi, and Shimla. More From This Section LIVE news: Air India suspends flights to Tel Aviv until Aug 8 due to Israel-Palestine crisis Parliament LIVE news: Spreading disinformation, alleges BJP MP on LoP Rahul Gandhi's ED remark Ghatkopar reminder: Thane hoarding collapse injures three amid new rules Atishi orders probe into deaths of 14 inmates of Asha Kiran shelter home Over 29,000 hospitals empanelled till June under Ayushman Bharat: Govt
IMD issues 'orange alert' for Kerala
The IMD Kerala has issued an "orange" alert for the Wayanad district until Saturday. The district has already been significantly impacted by landslides, resulting in over 340 deaths.
IMD Kerala director, Neetha K Gopal, said ‚ÄúWe have issued an orange alert in four northern districts of Kerala, including Wayanad. In the south, up to Pathanamthitta, we have also issued a yellow alert. From tomorrow (August 3) on, there will be a considerable reduction in rainfall activity. So the yellow alerts are being confirmed only for the northern districts of Kerala. And then from Sunday, there will be a reduction and we will be experiencing only light to moderate rain thereafter for another four days.‚Äù
IMD weather forecast: Rainfall across India
Light rain showers were experienced in various parts of Delhi on Thursday morning. The IMD has predicted intermittent rainfall in the national capital until August 5.
According to the IMD, heavy-to-very heavy rainfall is expected in Konkan, Goa, Madhya Maharashtra, and the Gujarat region from August 1 to August 5.
West Madhya Pradesh on 03rd& 04th; Gujarat Region, Konkan & Goa on 03rd; East Rajasthan on 04th August.
2) Monsoon is likely to be active over Northwest, Central & East India during next 3-4 days. pic.twitter.com/rqghvXr5iW ‚Äî India Meteorological Department (@Indiametdept) August 2, 2024
Madhya Pradesh will likely experience similar conditions from August 1 to August 4, while Vidarbha and Chhattisgarh can expect heavy rain from August 1 to August 3. Saurashtra and Kutch are predicted to receive heavy rain on August 3.
Additionally, isolated areas in Marathwada are predicted to receive heavy rainfall on August 3, and Saurashtra and Kutch again on August 4.
ALSO READ: Uttarakhand rains: 14 dead due to heavy rains, Kedarnath Yatra suspended
Uttarakhand is expected to see heavy rainfall from August 1 to August 3, while East Rajasthan will experience it from August 1 to August 4.
IMD weather: Heavy rainfall across India until August 7
Heavy rainfall is expected in isolated areas of Jammu and Kashmir, and Rajasthan from August 1 to August 5, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand from August 1 to August 7, Uttar Pradesh on August 1 to August 3, and again on August 6 and August 7, and in Punjab and Haryana-Chandigarh on August 1 and August 2.
The meteorological department has also issued a heavy rain warning for Jharkhand, Odisha, and Gangetic West Bengal on August 2. Additionally, the alert extends to Bihar, Assam, Meghalaya, Sub-Himalayan West Bengal and Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura from August 1 to August 7.
(With agency inputs) Also Read India to record above-normal rainfall in August and September, predicts IMD Crops expected to get higher rainfall over remainder of Monsoon season Halfway through monsoon: 16 states with normal rainfall, 10 face deficit Halfway into Monsoon season, 25% of Indian regions face rainfall deficit Delhi area where IAS aspirants died flooded again after heavy rains Topics : Indian monsoon monsoons Monsoon in UP Monsoon in India IMD on rains IMD weather forecast IMD monsoon forecast IMD Maharashtra Mumbai rains Mumbai Himachal Pradesh Uttarakhand Kerala landslide Waterlogging weather forecasts weather forecast BS Web Reports Don't miss the most important news and views of the day. Get them on our

author: Clement
title: Ja Morant On His Controversial Celebration After Memphis Grizzlies Win - BlackSportsOnline
text: Ja Morant is in the news again over his controversial celebration following another Memphis Grizzlies win. He‚Äôs been blasted on the internet for his celebration which people interpreted as firing guns. You know he‚Äôs been caught up in some gun stuff in the past and this celebration is being linked to firing or portraying guns. [READ ALSO: Dak Prescott‚Äôs Ex-Girlfriend Natalie Buffett Has Moved On And Now Is With MLB Pitcher Jack Flaherty](https://blacksportsonline.com/2023/12/dak-prescotts-ex-girlfriend-natalie-buffett-has-moved-on-and-now-is-with-mlb-pitcher-jack-flaherty/) But according to Morant, the celebration was a ‚ÄòRock Ya Hips‚Äô dance and not firing guns as it‚Äôs been speculated out there. [Morant](https://nypost.com/2023/12/27/sports/ja-morant-taking-heat-in-grizzlies-celebration-controversy/?utm_campaign=nypost_sports&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter&sr_share=twitter) reposted a video on X that compiled clips of LSU football players unveiling similar dances while celebrating touchdowns, with some users suggesting perhaps Morant used it because the Grizzlies were playing in New Orleans. But others countered by criticizing Morant for unveiling anything that even resembled ‚Äî or could‚Äôve been confused for ‚Äî finger guns, given that he‚Äôd just returned from a 25-game suspension for flashing a handgun on Instagram Live for a second time. Ja Morant pulled out that BR cell [https://t.co/IF5379EDg9] [pic.twitter.com/25Kdw6u8hE] ‚Äî Racqy Balboa ‚ù§Ô∏èüç® (@RacqyDaRuler) [December 27, 2023] ‚ÄúThe optics of ja morant own employer promoting the flashing of gun hand motions after coming back from a 25 game suspension is insane,‚Äù one user wrote on X. The exact optics and context behind his dance remain unclear, and the Grizzlies‚Äô team account even shared a clip on social media. It was just a dance, but Morant has to know he is under an extremely spotlight, so he has to take everything under consideration. Flip to the next page for reactions‚Ä¶

author: Faith Braverman
title: Local celebrity tortoise goes on romantic journey
text:
WALLER ‚Äì Thirty-year-old Jeremy the tortoise is well-known online.
His viral antics include frequent escape attempts from Blue Heron Farm in Waller. His owners adopted him last year to grace their petting zoo and beer garden, but Jeremy proved to be more itinerant than they‚Äôd bargained for.
Recommended Videos
The 90-pound African spurred tortoise went missing so frequently that his owners were forced to put an Apple Air Tag on him to track his movements.
But around 5 p.m. on Wednesday, Jeremy‚Äôs owners posted that the tortoise was once again lost, and they were not getting ANY hits on his Air Tag.
pic.twitter.com/a8bXQGjBwP
‚Äî Blue Heron Farm (@BlueHeronFarmTX) March 13, 2024 ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve put him in lost mode,‚Äù the post said.
While Jeremy is known for sneaking off the farm, his owners were worried that Jeremy may have been taken.
It turned out to be a little bit of both.
Jeremy did indeed wander off the Waller farm -- and was picked up by a concerned citizen who took him to his OWN tortoise farm a mile away. Jeremy‚Äôs owners were able to track down his location Thursday using social media, but by the time they arrived, Jeremy had become romantically entangled with a female tortoise.
When a user asked if Jeremy was perhaps roaming in search of a mate, his owners replied, ‚ÄúWas not out looking for a girlfriend, he just got lucky and found one where they took him.‚Äù
What is love if not a game of luck?
His owners say they‚Äôll be picking him up and bringing him home once his romantic rendezvous is over. It also turns out their location is too rural for the Air Tag to be of any use.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre just going to put a dog tag with our phone number on his shell next,‚Äù they posted.
SEE ALSO: Drones for dogs? How technology is finding missing pets Man talks importance of microchipping pets after losing dog during car wreck Dogs abandoned in Houston‚Äôs January freeze find forever home thanks to Click2Houston! Copyright 2024 by KPRC Click2Houston - All rights reserved.

author: Shawn Deng, Hassan Tayier and Duarte Mendonca, CNN
title: At least 30 dead after Typhoon Gaemi cut off towns in China‚Äôs Hunan province | News | wsiltv.com
text:
Hong Kong (CNN) ‚Äî Heavy rains and floods from Typhoon Gaemi caused at least 30 deaths and left 35 people missing across eight towns in the southern Chinese province of Hunan, state-run news agency Xinhua reported on Thursday, citing local authorities.
On Thursday, rescue teams reached eight towns that had been cut off from the outside world since last Sunday, due to destroyed infrastructure and power grids.
‚ÄúAs of 12:00 on August 1, the roads, electricity, and communications in the eight towns in Zixing City most severely affected by Typhoon Gaemi are largely restored, and search and rescue efforts have made significant progress,‚Äù the local authorities confirmed to Xinhua.
Rescue operations are still underway, local authorities said.
In response to the severe flooding in Hunan, China raised its emergency response level to better support local disaster relief efforts and ensure basic living security for the affected people, the country‚Äôs Ministry of Emergency Management said Thursday.
Typhoon Gaemi initially made landfall in China on the evening of Thursday July 25, with winds approaching 110 kph (70 mph). The storm continued west-northwest through China, bringing heavy rainfall and winds, with forecasters predicting that rainfall could range from 150 to 250 mm (6 to 10 inches), with amounts up to 400 mm (15 inches) in higher elevation areas and along the coast.
The storm previously caused torrential flooding in Taiwan, with rainfall in five townships totaling over 1,285mm (50 inches).
Typhoon Gaemi was deflected off its forecasted track by Taiwan‚Äôs mountainous terrain and spent more than six hours offshore, making a loop near the Hualien coastline instead of making landfall on the evening of Wednesday, July 24.
Farther south, Gaemi had also flooded much of the Philippine capital after it worsened torrential monsoon rains.
The-CNN-Wire

author: MENAFN
title: Verityxr Strengthens Leadership Team With Appointment Of Dr. Doug Nelson, Phd As Chief Architect And Engineer | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - ACCESSWIRE) CHICAGO, IL / ACCESSWIRE / December 28, 2023 / VerityXR, a trailblazer in Extended Reality (XR) healthcare technologies, is excited to announce the appointment of Dr. Doug Nelson, PhD , as its new Chief Architect and Engineer. Dr. Nelson transitions from a consulting role to a permanent leadership position, reinforcing VerityXR's commitment to innovation and excellence in the field of XR technology .-
src="https://www.accesswire.com/imagelibrary/5b576890-2266-4f01-9548-77d58b13a742/820610/Welcome-to-the-Team-Doug-Nelson.jpg" alt="VerityXR is excited to announce the appointment of Dr. Doug Nelson, PhD, as its new Chief Architect and Engineer."> With a career spanning over two decades, Dr. Nelson is a distinguished figure in engineering and healthcare technology. His experience encompasses pivotal roles at industry giants such as Humana Inc., Centene Inc., MITRE, and Merck, Inc. Dr. Nelson is also recognized for his entrepreneurial spirit, co-founding the Federated Software Group (FSG), which achieved significant success and was later acquired by Boeing Inc. His work at FSG was crucial in developing advanced command and control systems for the US Air Force and the US Transportation Command, greatly enhancing global mobility across air, land, and sea.
As the Chief Architect and Engineer at VerityXR, Dr. Nelson will lead the development of Verity's innovative EnGauge XRTM platform. This platform stands at the forefront of revolutionizing pain management and physical rehabilitation through cutting-edge XR technology. Dr. Nelson's appointment marks a significant milestone in VerityXR's journey towards advancing healthcare technology.
Expressing his enthusiasm for the new role, Dr. Nelson said, "Joining VerityXR in a full-time capacity is an exhilarating opportunity. I am eager to contribute my expertise to enhance the EnGauge XRTM platform and make a tangible impact in the field of healthcare technology."
VerityXR's CEO Amish Patel, MD, MBA commented, "Dr. Nelson's vast experience and visionary approach are invaluable assets to our team. His leadership in engineering and development will undoubtedly propel VerityXR to new heights in XR technology innovation."
Shiva Rallapalli, MBA, Verity's COO said, "I've had a long association with Doug for over 12 years. He is the best person to lead our Product Development."
About VerityXR: Founded by University of Chicago Booth School of Business MBA graduates, together with a shared vision of transforming healthcare, Verity Technologies is at the vanguard of utilizing Extended Reality for pain management and physical rehabilitation solutions. The company is dedicated to providing groundbreaking treatment options and improving patient outcomes through the power of extended reality (XR) technology.
For media and/or business inquiries, please email: [email protected] or visit .
SOURCE: VerityXR

author: @hawaiinewsnow
title: First office-to-residential conversion in Downtown Honolulu now leasing
text: HONOLULU (HawaiiNewsNow) - A new chapter in affordable housing is unfolding in Downtown Honolulu for young professionals. The first office-to-residential conversion under the city‚Äôs Bill 7 program is now complete, providing a much-needed option for those seeking affordable rentals. The newly opened building at 1060 Bishop Street adds 52 affordable units into Oahu‚Äôs housing stock. It also signals a continuing gradual transformation of the downtown from a place to work -- to a place to live. The building offers a variety of units for residents earning 80% or less of the area median income. ‚ÄúThis was an existing building beforehand,‚Äù said Luke Williams of 1060 Bishop Street. ‚ÄúWe gutted it completely, added new plumbing stacks and whatever is needed into an old office building, and now it‚Äôs a residential building.‚Äù ‚ÄùWe‚Äôre grateful for the opportunity to contribute to finding solutions to Hawaii‚Äôs affordable housing crisis through this new project,‚Äù said Robert Kurisu, principal of 1060 Bishop Street, LLC. ‚ÄúThis project aims to address a critical need in our community by repurposing an existing structure for much-needed housing in the heart of Honolulu and revitalize our downtown community.‚Äù The project was built under Bill 7, which is meant to spur developers to build more affordable housing. ‚ÄúIncentives include real property tax exemptions and GET (general excise tax) exemptions, which ultimately allow the developer to pass along the savings to residents,‚Äù said Kurisu. Another incentive for developers until Bill 7 -- they don‚Äôt have to include parking, which, according to national trends, isn‚Äôt a problem for young urban dwellers. ‚ÄúThey are looking to not have to drive, especially young people under 35. They want to have all of their entertainment within a five-block radius,‚Äù said real estate expert Stephany Sofos. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôll bike to the gym, they‚Äôll bike to the beach, but that‚Äôs it,‚Äù she added. ‚ÄúAfter or on the weekends it‚Äôs pretty dead, it‚Äôs pretty dormant, it‚Äôs pretty quiet,‚Äù said City Council Member Tyler Dos Santos-Tam, who represents the area. ‚ÄúSo to have residents down there who are going to patronize the coffee shops and the restaurants and help bring new energy in -- that‚Äôs super important.‚Äù A lot of the transformation is happening on Bishop Street, which is still the center of Hawaii‚Äôs financial district. But the area now includes the AC Hotel Honolulu, on the corner of Hotel Street. There‚Äôs also the 22-story Davies Pacific Center, which is being transformed into a mixed used condo called ‚ÄúModea.‚Äù It will have 352 units ranging from $400,000 studios to three-bedrooms units starting at $1 million. The reduction in available office space isn‚Äôt a bad thing, according to Sofos. ‚ÄúAt one point they were about 25 percent vacant,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄòNow with these buildings being taken out, the inventory‚Äôs gotten smaller, so people are getting into these office buildings faster.‚Äù 1060 Bishop Street includes 52 units, with studios ranging from 281 to 391 square feet for $1,950 per month. One-bedroom units range from 372 to 581 square feet, starting at $2,089 per month, while two-bedroom units are 791 square feet and rent for $2,506 per month. Utilities are included, and a discounted TV and high-speed internet package is available for an additional fee. Applications for studio, one and two bedroom apartments are being accepted now. You can learn more and submit a lease applications by clicking here . Copyright 2024 Hawaii News Now. All rights reserved.
